programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes led the Kansas City Chiefs to a 38-35 victory over the Philadelphia Eagles with two fourth-quarter touchdown passes and a decisive 26-yard scramble. The Chiefs won their second NFL title in four years and two-time NFL MVP Mahomes earned his second Super Bowl MVP award.

programme.desc: Relive the Week 3, 2018 matchup between the New York Jets and the Cleveland Browns, the No. 1 overall pick replaced injured starter Tyrod Taylor and sparked the Browns, who got two 1-yard touchdown runs from Carlos Hyde and beat the New York Jets 21-17 on Thursday night for their first win since Dec. 24, 2016.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.desc: Darlene has issues with Dan's plumbing work in her new house; Jackie tries to find a caregiver for Bev.

programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: Everybody Hates Chris
programme.desc: When Julius and Rochelle decide to raise Mr. Omar's rent, Mr. Omar demands they bring the apartment up to code and moves in with Chris' family until the repairs are done.

programme.desc: The new school Principal pairs Chris and Caruso as buddies on an upcoming field trip.

programme.desc: Chris and his family decide to take a trip down South to attend the funeral of Julius' distant relative.

programme.title: Everybody Hates Chris

programme.desc: "The Painted Hills" (1951) Adventure. A collie, played by Lassie, avenges its gold-miner master.

programme.desc: "The Giant Spider Invasion" (1975) Cult. Scientist and girlfriend spy car-size mutant spiders; with Steve Brodie, Barbara Hale.

programme.desc: Secret Agent Bart Fargo chases the kidnappers of the inventor of a death ray. Tom makes his own death ray for peaceful use but caves in to the pressure to use it on Crow.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "City Limits" (1985) Science fiction. Two gangs of teenage bikers rule a divided city with jousts in a post-plague future of no adults.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a dramatic elimination, the remaining 17 home cooks are greeted by Chef Ramsay and Tosi, as well as special guests Season Six winner Claudia Sandoval and guest culinary judge Aaron Sanchez, as they reveal the next mystery box challenge. Each contestant will have 60 minutes to create his/her own unique dish using a number of Sandoval’s favorite ingredients. The winner of the challenge will not only be safe from the next elimination round, but will also help in deciding the fate of three other contestants in the elimination. Find out who is saved and who survives elimination.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: A battle of the culinary world’s next generation comes to a head in an exciting finale showdown. The season began with 24 contestants, but only three young chef-testants are left standing. The challenges this season were more intense, and more inspiring, than ever before. It’s a fight to the finish and only one will take it all home – the trophy, the coveted title of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR and the $100,000 grand prize. Watch the home cooks dish up the best three-course meal of their lives, proving they have what it takes to win.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Move over grown-ups...the kids are taking over the kitchen.

programme.desc: Chef Ramsay continues to work with the owner of Mill Street Bistro to fix his belligerent attitude.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: In Seattle, Chef Ramsay hopes to improve a family-owned Greek restaurant that resists catering to the changing demographic of the neighborhood.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: It's time for the sauciest Blind Taste Test Challenge ever and a world-class charity dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs compete in three unique cooking challenges to receive a black jacket.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In their first MASTERCHEF field challenge, the Top 18 home cooks are divided in to two teams where they will have to prepare appetizers and entrees for a very special guest and member of the MASTERCHEF family, season 6 contestant Nick Nappi on his wedding day! Not only will they feel the pressure from Gordon Ramsay, Christina Tosi and a former contestant but also Nick’s bride and 72 hungry wedding guests. The winning team will earn a significant advantage in the next elimination challenge.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The final four chefs compete to be in Entertainment Weekly. Chef Ramsay drops sabotages during dinner service.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: This week, the remaining 16 home cooks get a very special treat leading into the next challenge, as Chef Ramsay demonstrates how to properly deconstruct a lobster. They will then each have 25 minutes to kill, poach and shell a lobster, just as they learned from the master, and the winner will have the advantage of choosing which team he or she will join for the next field challenge. For the second part of the challenge, Chef Ramsay demonstrates how to make lobster tortellini in a seafood broth. The contestants have 45 minutes to recreate Ramsay’s dish. Find out who survives elimination.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining 15 home cooks will separate into two teams for the second major field challenge of the competition, cooking for 101 hungry veterans! The two teams will have 75 minutes to prep, and one hour to serve a dish consisting of a steak, two sides and a sauce. After a dramatic day out in the field, the veterans will have the power to vote for their favorite dish. The team with the most votes will be safe in the competition, while the team with the least amount of votes will face the pressure test.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is back at Longmeadow, getting stuck into some seasonal jobs. Arit Anderson and Nick Bailey present highlights from RHS Flower Show Tatton Park, and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to deal with drought, takes fuchsia cuttings and demonstrates how to summer prune fruit trees. Advolly Richmond reveals the important role that trees have played in gardens throughout history on a visit to Longleat. There's also a catch-up with three sisters in Dorset who developed a love of gardening during lockdown, this time, they plant up two beds, one for sun and one for shade.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty sows rocket, harvests chillies and tomatoes, and demonstrates how to take semi-ripe cuttings. Frances Tophill meets a head gardener in south London who's started gardening sustainably.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty undertakes more seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. Arit Anderson meets a garden designer in Somerset who has worked in harmony with nature to create a garden on a former brownfield site.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the holiday season well and truly upon us, Monty shares some timely tips on how to make sure your garden doesn't suffer while you are away. But there are some gardeners that daren't leave home, as Joe Swift discovered when he met Phillip Vowles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join the team as they present the seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Adam Frost presents from his garden and suggests essential gardening jobs for the weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows what to do now to maximise next year's soft fruit crop by pruning his summer raspberries and planting on the strawberry runners he potted up a few weeks ago. As Monty harvests September's abundance in the vegetable garden he makes notes of the tastiest varieties he has grown this year which he would grow again next year, as well as sowing some quick growing crops to harvest in the autumn.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is busy ensuring that his plants are making the most of the warmth and light, and puts to use the homemade fertilizer he made a few weeks ago. He also catches up with his tomato growing trial to see how the different techniques are performing. Carol Klein gets to grips with flowering dogwoods, perhaps the most aristocratic and elegant of all garden trees, and there's a visit to a magical topiary garden in Kent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer marches on, Monty gets stuck into more seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. Adam Frost revels in the range of produce growing in a Victorian walled kitchen garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge which has become a focal point for the local community, and Frances Tophill shares the joy of collecting and saving heirloom vegetable seeds on a visit to Pembrokeshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond celebrate the horticultural genius of William Robinson in the gardens of his former home, Gravetye Manor in Sussex. Fresh off the back of her success at Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Sue Kent gives her own garden some TLC and creates a special container display using small pots. There's also a passionate grower in London who uses every available space in his garden to grow a vast range of vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame and Arit Anderson explore the role gardeners can play in having a positive impact on wildlife in their gardens, allotments and communal green spaces. Nick Bailey meets an entomologist on a mission to change perceptions of common garden pests, Kate Bradbury shows how she gardens in harmony with wildlife on her allotment, and there's a look at a city garden where the wildlife is flourishing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After a short break, Monty's back at Longmeadow. With a change of seasons, he demonstrates how to prune summer fruiting raspberries, divides perennials and plants daffodils and hyacinths in containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Adam Frost in his garden, where he will be giving tips on laying turf, planting succulents and adding perennial plants to his kitchen garden to grow as cut flowers. Joe Swift travels to Marwood Hill Gardens in Devon to explore plants that thrive in moist conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow, keeping on top of seasonal maintenance as well as enjoying the plants of high summer. Adam Frost travels to Sissinghurst Castle Gardens to view a new area of the garden which was inspired by a visit to the Greek island of Delos, and in Berkshire we find out how one gardener keeps her garden full of interest in every season of the year. In West Sussex, we get tips on growing the perfect dahlia from a grower with over 50 years of experience.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants garlic, demonstrates how to divide crocosmia and sows ornamental grass seeds. Adam Frost visits Lowther Castle in the Lake District and finds out about its garden restoration project.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross creates a beautiful golden warm waterfall scene, employing a lovely almost watercolor-looking effect. Come join in the fun!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to the Lowcountry to rendezvous with good friend Capt. Ben Alderman.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike reunites with his South Seas comrade for a day of trout madness.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the back, back-country where even the fish struggle to find water.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike tries to hold his own while fishing with Nick Fischer and Liza Fitzgerald in south seas Captiva. Good luck buddy.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: The crew heads up to Leech Lake in Northern MN targeting early ice bluegills out of Trapper’s Landing Lodge.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Finding roaming perch on big mudflats can take time but using a presentation that can help “call” fish in from a distance can be the difference maker. A technique developed on open water situations, the drop-shot has its place for hardwater applications as well.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny tries his hand at being a guide on the Manistee River with Koz. Then later Danny tries his fly fishing skills on the Crystal River to see if he can land a monster salmon on the fly.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny brings his buddy Ryan to Port St. Joe for scalloping season. They hook up with Guillermo from Blacks Island to show them how it’s done.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Richard Black & Capt. Randy fish Biscayne Bay.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Sammy Millazo Fishing Offshore Islamorada.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we will explore the crystal-clear waters of Islamorada to experience all this area has to offer. We will highlight the critical roll sharks play in our eco system and what is being done to protect them.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we highlight some of the best diving in the lower Keys. From the wreck of the Vandenberg too the beautiful reefs in Key West, this show has it all.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny joins True North Trout and Koz as they hit the Manistee River for a bit of trout fishing on the fly.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny tries his hand at being a guide on the Manistee River with Koz. Then later Danny tries his fly fishing skills on the Crystal River to see if he can land a monster salmon on the fly.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny brings his buddy Ryan to Port St. Joe for scalloping season. They hook up with Guillermo from Blacks Island to show them how it’s done.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by Ryan Sheffield for some fishing on Cape San Blas. They meet up with Mark Moore to go fishing for Reds and Trout. Later, they cook up the catch.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff hear about the dangers of fishing for Bluefin Tuna in the Atlantic Ocean from locals in Gloucester, Massachusetts. Then they head 30 miles out onto the open ocean with Darrin of Reel Respect Charters in the hopes of landing their own giant.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair meets up with Capt. Ron Ryals to fish the phosphate pits of Bienville outdoors, an amazing spot for hunting and trophy bass catching.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair goes back to Marco Island with Capt. Chris Broome to tackle the beautiful inshore spots before heading offshore the next day.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team take a trip to Marine Surplus in order to gather miscellaneous parts for AquaSport project such as cleats, rod holders, and a rub rail getting them one step closer to finishing the project. The crew then heads back to the project were they get to work on installing the parts gathered and getting the AquaSport accessorized.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway Nicky Buckley winds up our Christmas Markets cruise in Europe, enjoying all the festive favorites through Germany and into Amsterdam.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s no secret that sight fishing clear emerald green water is a favorite of local anglers when conditions are perfect. But perfection is rare. Justin & Travis share methods and techniques for finding and catching fish when the conditions are less than perfect on the beach and in the bay.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by MMA fighter Clay Guide for the exciting variety of Barracuda, Sharks and Jacks in the Middle Keys Channel Flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by young guide Richard Black as he leads them to a backcountry slam.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by young up and coming guide Anthony Vargas, who puts them on a wide variety of game fish in the Keys backcountry.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Key West guide Nick LaBadie, a talented guide with a special knack for finding permit on the Key West flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by New York Cop Mike Counihan, who brings his passion for fitness and fishing along as the crew take on sharks in the Middle Florida Keys flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor rise early for a full day of adventure in the Keys, rocking the sunrise for baby tarpon, scoring on some mid-day permit, and watching the sun go down in search for big tarpon.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Zimbabwe's water woes have affected urban and rural areas alike, leaving whole communities vulnerable to waterborne diseases due to a lack of access to clean water. In more remote areas, access to water found in the Zambezi River is painstaking at best. Called by a higher power, “Brother Bill” Evans, a charismatic pastor from Kentucky, and Leonard Maronda, caretaker of the Mission House in Zimbabwe, have combined forces to drill borehole wells that bring free and fresh water to the remote villages of Zimbabwe. Brother Bill and Leonard have since installed a dozen wells and repaired a number of others, providing an estimated 44,000 gallons a day of clean, potable water to thousands of people in need of this vital resource. Above all, "Under the African Sun" is a touching story of hope: for Africa, for the future, for humanity.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Rivers are Life team joins the Michigan Department of Natural Resources on the St. Clair River to assist in catching and tagging lake sturgeon as part of an ongoing conservation effort. Aboard the DNR’s Channel Cat research vessel, we learn about the sturgeon's ecological role, cultural significance, and the challenges the iconic fish faces—from invasive species to habitat loss. The project supports sturgeon population recovery through egg collection, hatchery programs, and community events like Port Huron’s Sturgeon Fest, organized by the Friends of the St. Clair River. Every year since its inception in 2012, Sturgeon Fest has released young sturgeon back into the wild, contributing to the unique species' resurgence in the Great Lakes region. This year, the Rivers are Life team helped tag two juvenile sturgeons, which made their debut in the popular festival's touch tank before release.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Join host Brad Rucks for a thrilling turkey hunting adventure across three unforgettable outings. He starts off solo, setting the tone with a determined first hunt. Next, he teams up with JJ from Federal Ammunition. Finally, Brad’s son Noah joins in for a memorable hunt of his own, bringing the journey full circle.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don’t recognize that they’re less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that’s caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they’ll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin invites life long PCB resident Griff Griffiths onboard and reveals the silver king migration is happening right in the midst all the beach-goers activities. Then ultimately landing his first local tarpon right on the beach he grew up on.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s no secret that sight fishing clear emerald green water is a favorite of local anglers when conditions are perfect. But perfection is rare. Justin & Travis share methods and techniques for finding and catching fish when the conditions are less than perfect on the beach and in the bay.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: What fish can you chase 365 days a year in almost any weather conditions in deep, shallow, skinny, stained or crystal clear water with a variety of baits and tactics? Justin & Travis illustrate how the Redfish is the go to sport fish that they will never get tired of chasing.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin has Humminbird’s Bill Carson onboard to show him how the new CoastMaster charts look in Panama City Beach waters and find it’s not just red snapper that populate these waters. It’s a smorgasbord of snapper for the cooler.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger meet up with Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for a taste of what the Texas Gulf Coast has to offer.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger join Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for some hot Red Snapper action.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger go north for a change to sight fish tripletails in Florida Bay.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger head to the hump on a windy day to target tunas and find some bonus mahis and tripletails as well.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Being consistently productive on the water means knowing how to adapt to conditions. Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger switch it up and fish shallow for sailfish.

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the back, back-country where even the fish struggle to find water.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Rex link up with Gehrig Dieter and Anthony Sherman from the Kansas City Chiefs. While filling the boat with crappie they got to learn about the guys and their careers in the NFL.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards are heads to Table Rock for the annual family vacation. Receding water poses a challenge but there’s no lack of fish or laughs at the lake!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with some friends at the Idaho Fish and Game Department to ice fish for cutthroat trout. Looking to test the results of previous restocking efforts, they'll be heading to some of the most remote lakes in the state only accessible by snowmobile.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Northern Maine to hunt for moose and learn about the conservation of this species which is under attack by winter ticks. Can reducing moose numbers be the key to saving the local moose population from this deadly parasite?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green is joined by his childhood friends in his home state of Michigan for a trout fishing adventure. They visit the most dynamic landmarks in the Upper Peninsula, do a little cliff jumping, and finish out the trip cooking trout riverside.

programme.title: Silver Kings

programme.title: Silver Kings

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Army veteran and retired police officer Dan Jarvis details his journey of life in the military and law enforcement and his new mission of helping those still struggling with PTSD from all walks of life!

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Lifelong cowboy and Oklahoma native Bill Parker is believed to be the 1st man to reach the shores of Normandy on D-day…June 6th 1944.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes

programme.desc: Mark and Trenton spend one day at their home lake of Taylorsville seeing if they can catch some fall bass. This episode is to show how Taylorsville lake can have a good fall bite while they stay close to home with bust schedules.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. programme.desc: Finding roaming perch on big mudflats can take time but using a presentation that can help “call” fish in from a distance can be the difference maker. A technique developed on open water situations, the drop-shot has its place for hardwater applications as well.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we will explore the crystal-clear waters of Islamorada to experience all this area has to offer. We will highlight the critical roll sharks play in our eco system and what is being done to protect them.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we highlight some of the best diving in the lower Keys. From the wreck of the Vandenberg too the beautiful reefs in Key West, this show has it all.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny joins True North Trout and Koz as they hit the Manistee River for a bit of trout fishing on the fly.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny tries his hand at being a guide on the Manistee River with Koz. Then later Danny tries his fly fishing skills on the Crystal River to see if he can land a monster salmon on the fly.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny brings his buddy Ryan to Port St. Joe for scalloping season. They hook up with Guillermo from Blacks Island to show them how it’s done.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by Ryan Sheffield for some fishing on Cape San Blas. They meet up with Mark Moore to go fishing for Reds and Trout. Later, they cook up the catch.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff hear about the dangers of fishing for Bluefin Tuna in the Atlantic Ocean from locals in Gloucester, Massachusetts. Then they head 30 miles out onto the open ocean with Darrin of Reel Respect Charters in the hopes of landing their own giant.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Rivers are Life team joins the Michigan Department of Natural Resources on the St. Clair River to assist in catching and tagging lake sturgeon as part of an ongoing conservation effort. Aboard the DNR’s Channel Cat research vessel, we learn about the sturgeon's ecological role, cultural significance, and the challenges the iconic fish faces—from invasive species to habitat loss. The project supports sturgeon population recovery through egg collection, hatchery programs, and community events like Port Huron’s Sturgeon Fest, organized by the Friends of the St. Clair River. Every year since its inception in 2012, Sturgeon Fest has released young sturgeon back into the wild, contributing to the unique species' resurgence in the Great Lakes region. This year, the Rivers are Life team helped tag two juvenile sturgeons, which made their debut in the popular festival's touch tank before release.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Join host Brad Rucks for a thrilling turkey hunting adventure across three unforgettable outings. He starts off solo, setting the tone with a determined first hunt. Next, he teams up with JJ from Federal Ammunition. Finally, Brad’s son Noah joins in for a memorable hunt of his own, bringing the journey full circle.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: When most people visit the Big Easy they don’t recognize that they’re less than 45 minutes away from one of the best fishing spots in the country. In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that’s caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they’ll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin invites life long PCB resident Griff Griffiths onboard and reveals the silver king migration is happening right in the midst all the beach-goers activities. Then ultimately landing his first local tarpon right on the beach he grew up on.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s no secret that sight fishing clear emerald green water is a favorite of local anglers when conditions are perfect. But perfection is rare. Justin & Travis share methods and techniques for finding and catching fish when the conditions are less than perfect on the beach and in the bay.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: What fish can you chase 365 days a year in almost any weather conditions in deep, shallow, skinny, stained or crystal clear water with a variety of baits and tactics? Justin & Travis illustrate how the Redfish is the go to sport fish that they will never get tired of chasing.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin has Humminbird’s Bill Carson onboard to show him how the new CoastMaster charts look in Panama City Beach waters and find it’s not just red snapper that populate these waters. It’s a smorgasbord of snapper for the cooler.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Rex link up with Gehrig Dieter and Anthony Sherman from the Kansas City Chiefs. While filling the boat with crappie they got to learn about the guys and their careers in the NFL.

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with some friends at the Idaho Fish and Game Department to ice fish for cutthroat trout. Looking to test the results of previous restocking efforts, they'll be heading to some of the most remote lakes in the state only accessible by snowmobile.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Northern Maine to hunt for moose and learn about the conservation of this species which is under attack by winter ticks. Can reducing moose numbers be the key to saving the local moose population from this deadly parasite?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green is joined by his childhood friends in his home state of Michigan for a trout fishing adventure. They visit the most dynamic landmarks in the Upper Peninsula, do a little cliff jumping, and finish out the trip cooking trout riverside.

programme.title: Scary Movie 5

programme.desc: When a trusted operative disappears inside an elaborate black site prison, security specialist Ray Breslin assembles an elite team to break him out.

programme.desc: In this explosive action saga, Ray Breslin and his team of security experts fight to rescue his girlfriend and a tech mogul’s daughter.

programme.title: Mile 22
programme.desc: An elite American intelligence official tries to smuggle a mysterious police officer with sensitive information out of the country.

programme.title: In the Blood
programme.desc: A vigilante bride must outwit and outfight a foreign underworld to uncover the secrets behind her husband's disappearance in this dynamic thriller.

programme.desc: A grieving Colorado snow plow driver sets out to take revenge on the psychopathic drug lord responsible for his son’s mysterious heroin overdose.

programme.title: Cops and Robbersons

programme.title: Nadine
programme.desc: While recovering sexy photos of herself from a dishonest photographer, a woman witnesses a murder and finds herself at the center of a conspiracy.

programme.title: Wedding Wars

programme.title: The First Time
programme.desc: What begins as a casual chat turns into something more complex, as a romance blooms between a high school junior and a senior on his way to college.

programme.title: North

programme.title: Blonde Ambition

programme.title: Double Platinum

programme.title: Race the Sun

programme.title: Fresh Horses
programme.desc: Jewel married a gun-totin' good ol' boy Green, with whom she has ostensibly never had sex. But when she meets rich kid Matt, it's love at first sight.

programme.title: Places in the Heart
programme.desc: This stirring drama follows a widow as she struggles to raise her two children and save her Texas farm during the Great Depression.

programme.title: First Knight

programme.title: I Dreamed of Africa

programme.title: Breakable You
programme.desc: The film follows the Wellers, a dynamic New York City family, as they come to terms with changes in their personal lives and each other.

programme.title: Life Without Dick
programme.desc: After shooting her boyfriend, she meets the hitman who had been planning to kill him. As the two dispose of his body, romantic sparks begin to fly.

programme.title: Held Up
programme.desc: Everything changes for a bored bank teller who hates everything about his life the day two different gangs of bank robbers bust through the door.

programme.title: Wilder Napalm
programme.desc: Sparks fly when two brothers, a workaday joe and a circus performer, who possess pyrokinetic minds, start fires and vie for the love of one hot woman.

programme.title: Runaway

programme.title: Blue-Eyed Butcher
programme.desc: Based on the shocking true story about a beautiful young wife and mother accused of the brutal murder of her seemingly perfect husband.

programme.title: Miracle on the Mountain: The Kincaid Family Story
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this film recounts a family's struggle for survival after their private plane crashes on their way to a cabin in the mountains.

programme.title: Every Time We Say Goodbye

programme.title: Mary Reilly

programme.title: Crazy in Alabama
